import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Delete organization users by query"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/organizations/users/query"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Deletes organization-user relationships matching the provided query parameters. Use this for bulk cleanup when you can identify the relationships to remove via OrganizationId or other query constraints.

**Workflow Example**
1. Preview matches with [GET /api/v1.0/organizations/users/query](/docs/api/organizations/get-organization-users-by-query-get) and confirm the list.
2. Call [DELETE /api/v1.0/organizations/users/query](/docs/api/organizations/delete-organization-users-by-query) with OrganizationId to remove matching relationships.

**Minimal Required Fields**: OrganizationId is recommended to scope deletion.

**Notes**: This API version is deprecated and performs a destructive bulk action.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"OrganizationId","in":"query","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}

>
